content: 1 After the death of Saul—David had already returned from defeating the Amalekites—David stayed two days in Ziklag.
content_old: 1 After the death of Saul—David had already returned from defeating the Amalekites—David stayed two days in Ziklag.

content: 2 On the third day, a man came from Saul’s camp, with his clothes rent and earth on his head; and as he approached David, he flung himself to the ground and bowed low.
content_old: 2 On the third day, a man came from Saul’s camp, with his clothes rent and earth on his head; and as he approached David, he flung himself to the ground and bowed low.

content: 3 David said to him, “Where are you coming from?” He answered, “I have just escaped from the camp of Israel.”
content_old: 3 David said to him, “Where are you coming from?” He answered, “I have just escaped from the camp of Israel.”

content: 4 “What happened?” asked David. “Tell me!” And he told him how the troops had fled the battlefield, and that, moreover, many of the troops had fallen and died; also that Saul and his son Jonathan were dead.
content_old: 4 “What happened?” asked David. “Tell me!” And he told him how the troops had fled the battlefield, and that, moreover, many of the troops had fallen and died; also that Saul and his son Jonathan were dead.

content: 5 “How do you know,” David asked the young man who brought him the news, “that Saul and his son Jonathan are dead?”
content_old: 5 “How do you know,” David asked the young man who brought him the news, “that Saul and his son Jonathan are dead?”

content: 6 The young man who brought him the news answered, “I happened to be at Mount Gilboa, and I saw Saul leaning on his spear, and the chariots and horsemen closing in on him.
content_old: 6 The young man who brought him the news answered, “I happened to be at Mount Gilboa, and I saw Saul leaning on his spear, and the chariots and horsemen closing in on him.

content: 7 He looked around and saw me, and he called to me. When I responded, ‘At your service,’
content_old: 7 He looked around and saw me, and he called to me. When I responded, ‘At your service,’

content: 8 he asked me, ‘Who are you?’ And I told him that I was an Amalekite.
content_old: 8 he asked me, ‘Who are you?’ And I told him that I was an Amalekite.

content: 9 Then he said to me, ‘Stand over me, and finish me off, for I am in agony and am barely alive.’
content_old: 9 Then he said to me, ‘Stand over me, and finish me off, for I am in agony and am barely alive.’

content: 10 So I stood over him and finished him off, for I knew that he would never rise from where he was lying. Then I took the crown from his head and the armlet from his arm, and I have brought them here to my lord.”
content_old: 10 So I stood over him and finished him off, for I knew that he would never rise from where he was lying. Then I took the crown from his head and the armlet from his arm, and I have brought them here to my lord.”

content: 11 David took hold of his clothes and rent them, and so did all the men with him.
content_old: 11 David took hold of his clothes and rent them, and so did all the men with him.

content: 12 They lamented and wept, and they fasted until evening for Saul and his son Jonathan, and for the soldiers of the LORD and the House of Israel who had fallen by the sword.
content_old: 12 They lamented and wept, and they fasted until evening for Saul and his son Jonathan, and for the soldiers of the LORD and the House of Israel who had fallen by the sword.

content: 13 David said to the young man who had brought him the news, “Where are you from?” He replied, “I am the son of a resident alien, an Amalekite.”
content_old: 13 David said to the young man who had brought him the news, “Where are you from?” He replied, “I am the son of a resident alien, an Amalekite.”

content: 14 “How did you dare,” David said to him, “to lift your hand and kill the LORD’s anointed?”
content_old: 14 “How did you dare,” David said to him, “to lift your hand and kill the LORD’s anointed?”

content: 15 Thereupon David called one of the attendants and said to him, “Come over and strike him!” He struck him down and he died.
content_old: 15 Thereupon David called one of the attendants and said to him, “Come over and strike him!” He struck him down and he died.

content: 16 And David said to him, “Your blood be on your own head! Your own mouth testified against you when you said, ‘I put the LORD’s anointed to death.’ ”
content_old: 16 And David said to him, “Your blood be on your own head! Your own mouth testified against you when you said, ‘I put the LORD’s anointed to death.’ ”

content: 17 And David intoned this dirge over Saul and his son Jonathan—
content_old: 17 And David intoned this dirge over Saul and his son Jonathan—

content: 18 He ordered the Judites to be taught The Song of the Bow. It is recorded in the Book of Jashar.
content_old: 18 He ordered the Judites to be taught The Song of the Bow. It is recorded in the Book of Jashar.

content: 19 Your glory, O Israel, Lies slain on your heights; How have the mighty fallen!
content_old: 19 Your glory, O Israel, Lies slain on your heights; How have the mighty fallen!

content: 20 Tell it not in Gath, Do not proclaim it in the streets of Ashkelon, Lest the daughters of the Philistine rejoice, Lest the daughters of the uncircumcised exult.
content_old: 20 Tell it not in Gath, Do not proclaim it in the streets of Ashkelon, Lest the daughters of the Philistine rejoice, Lest the daughters of the uncircumcised exult.

content: 21 O hills of Gilboa— Let there be no dew or rain on you, Or bountiful fields, For there the shield of warriors lay rejected, The shield of Saul, Polished with oil no more.
content_old: 21 O hills of Gilboa— Let there be no dew or rain on you, Or bountiful fields, For there the shield of warriors lay rejected, The shield of Saul, Polished with oil no more.

content: 22 From the blood of slain, From the fat of warriors— The bow of Jonathan Never turned back; The sword of Saul Never withdrew empty.
content_old: 22 From the blood of slain, From the fat of warriors— The bow of Jonathan Never turned back; The sword of Saul Never withdrew empty.

content: 23 Saul and Jonathan, Beloved and cherished, Never parted In life or in death! They were swifter than eagles, They were stronger than lions!
content_old: 23 Saul and Jonathan, Beloved and cherished, Never parted In life or in death! They were swifter than eagles, They were stronger than lions!

content: 24 Daughters of Israel, Weep over Saul, Who clothed you in crimson and finery, Who decked your robes with jewels of gold.
content_old: 24 Daughters of Israel, Weep over Saul, Who clothed you in crimson and finery, Who decked your robes with jewels of gold.

content: 25 How have the mighty fallen In the thick of battle— Jonathan, slain on your heights!
content_old: 25 How have the mighty fallen In the thick of battle— Jonathan, slain on your heights!

content: 26 I grieve for you, My brother Jonathan, You were most dear to me. Your love was wonderful to me More than the love of women.
content_old: 26 I grieve for you, My brother Jonathan, You were most dear to me. Your love was wonderful to me More than the love of women.

content: 1 Sometime afterward, David inquired of the LORD, “Shall I go up to one of the towns of Judah?” The LORD answered, “Yes.” David further asked, “Which one shall I go up to?” And the LORD replied, “To Hebron.”
content_old: 1 Sometime afterward, David inquired of the LORD, “Shall I go up to one of the towns of Judah?” The LORD answered, “Yes.” David further asked, “Which one shall I go up to?” And the LORD replied, “To Hebron.”

content: 2 So David went up there, along with his two wives, Ahinoam of Jezreel and Abigail wife of Nabal the Carmelite.
content_old: 2 So David went up there, along with his two wives, Ahinoam of Jezreel and Abigail wife of Nabal the Carmelite.

content: 3 David also took the men who were with him, each with his family, and they settled in the towns about Hebron.
content_old: 3 David also took the men who were with him, each with his family, and they settled in the towns about Hebron.

content: 4 The men of Judah came and there they anointed David king over the House of Judah. David was told about the men of Jabesh-gilead who buried Saul.
content_old: 4 The men of Judah came and there they anointed David king over the House of Judah. David was told about the men of Jabesh-gilead who buried Saul.

content: 5 So David sent messengers to the men of Jabesh-gilead and said to them, “May you be blessed of the LORD because you performed this act of faithfulness to your lord Saul and buried him.
content_old: 5 So David sent messengers to the men of Jabesh-gilead and said to them, “May you be blessed of the LORD because you performed this act of faithfulness to your lord Saul and buried him.

content: 6 May the LORD in turn show you true faithfulness; and I too will reward you generously because you performed this act.
content_old: 6 May the LORD in turn show you true faithfulness; and I too will reward you generously because you performed this act.

content: 7 Now take courage and be brave men; for your lord Saul is dead and the House of Judah have already anointed me king over them.”
content_old: 7 Now take courage and be brave men; for your lord Saul is dead and the House of Judah have already anointed me king over them.”

content: 8 But Abner son of Ner, Saul’s army commander, had taken Ish-bosheth son of Saul and brought him across to Mahanaim
content_old: 8 But Abner son of Ner, Saul’s army commander, had taken Ish-bosheth son of Saul and brought him across to Mahanaim

content: 9 and made him king over Gilead, the Ashurites, Jezreel, Ephraim, and Benjamin—over all Israel.
content_old: 9 and made him king over Gilead, the Ashurites, Jezreel, Ephraim, and Benjamin—over all Israel.

content: 10 Ish-bosheth son of Saul was forty years old when he became king of Israel, and he reigned two years. But the House of Judah supported David.
content_old: 10 Ish-bosheth son of Saul was forty years old when he became king of Israel, and he reigned two years. But the House of Judah supported David.

content: 11 The length of time that David reigned in Hebron over the House of Judah was seven years and six months.
content_old: 11 The length of time that David reigned in Hebron over the House of Judah was seven years and six months.

content: 12 Once Abner son of Ner and the soldiers of Ish-bosheth son of Saul marched out from Mahanaim to Gibeon,
content_old: 12 Once Abner son of Ner and the soldiers of Ish-bosheth son of Saul marched out from Mahanaim to Gibeon,

content: 13 and Joab son of Zeruiah and the soldiers of David came out. They confronted one another at the pool of Gibeon: one group sat on one side of the pool, and the other group on the other side of the pool.
content_old: 13 and Joab son of Zeruiah and the soldiers of David came out. They confronted one another at the pool of Gibeon: one group sat on one side of the pool, and the other group on the other side of the pool.

content: 14 Abner said to Joab, “Let the young men come forward and sport before us.” “Yes, let them,” Joab answered.
content_old: 14 Abner said to Joab, “Let the young men come forward and sport before us.” “Yes, let them,” Joab answered.

content: 15 They came forward and were counted off, twelve for Benjamin and Ish-bosheth son of Saul, and twelve of David’s soldiers.
content_old: 15 They came forward and were counted off, twelve for Benjamin and Ish-bosheth son of Saul, and twelve of David’s soldiers.

content: 16 Each one grasped his opponent’s head and thrust his dagger into his opponent’s side; thus they fell together. That place, which is in Gibeon, was called Helkath-hazzurim.
content_old: 16 Each one grasped his opponent’s head and thrust his dagger into his opponent’s side; thus they fell together. That place, which is in Gibeon, was called Helkath-hazzurim.

content: 17 A fierce battle ensued that day, and Abner and the men of Israel were routed by David’s soldiers.
content_old: 17 A fierce battle ensued that day, and Abner and the men of Israel were routed by David’s soldiers.

content: 18 The three sons of Zeruiah were there—Joab, Abishai, and Asahel. Asahel was swift of foot, like a gazelle in the open field.
content_old: 18 The three sons of Zeruiah were there—Joab, Abishai, and Asahel. Asahel was swift of foot, like a gazelle in the open field.

content: 19 And Asahel ran after Abner, swerving neither right nor left in his pursuit of Abner.
content_old: 19 And Asahel ran after Abner, swerving neither right nor left in his pursuit of Abner.

content: 20 Abner looked back and shouted, “Is that you, Asahel?” “Yes, it is,” he called back.
content_old: 20 Abner looked back and shouted, “Is that you, Asahel?” “Yes, it is,” he called back.

content: 21 Abner said to him, “Turn to the right or to the left, and seize one of our boys and strip off his tunic.” But Asahel would not leave off.
content_old: 21 Abner said to him, “Turn to the right or to the left, and seize one of our boys and strip off his tunic.” But Asahel would not leave off.

content: 22 Abner again begged Asahel, “Stop pursuing me, or I’ll have to strike you down. How will I look your brother Joab in the face?”
content_old: 22 Abner again begged Asahel, “Stop pursuing me, or I’ll have to strike you down. How will I look your brother Joab in the face?”

content: 23 When he refused to desist, Abner struck him in the belly with a backward thrust of his spear and the spear protruded from his back. He fell there and died on the spot. And all who came to the place where Asahel fell and died halted;
content_old: 23 When he refused to desist, Abner struck him in the belly with a backward thrust of his spear and the spear protruded from his back. He fell there and died on the spot. And all who came to the place where Asahel fell and died halted;

content: 24 but Joab and Abishai continued to pursue Abner. And the sun was setting as they reached the hill of Ammah, which faces Giah on the road to the wilderness of Gibeon.
content_old: 24 but Joab and Abishai continued to pursue Abner. And the sun was setting as they reached the hill of Ammah, which faces Giah on the road to the wilderness of Gibeon.

content: 25 The Benjaminites rallied behind Abner, forming a single company; and they took up a position on the top of a hill.
content_old: 25 The Benjaminites rallied behind Abner, forming a single company; and they took up a position on the top of a hill.

content: 26 Abner then called out to Joab, “Must the sword devour forever? You know how bitterly it’s going to end! How long will you delay ordering your troops to stop the pursuit of their kinsmen?”
content_old: 26 Abner then called out to Joab, “Must the sword devour forever? You know how bitterly it’s going to end! How long will you delay ordering your troops to stop the pursuit of their kinsmen?”

content: 27 And Joab replied, “As God lives, if you hadn’t spoken up, the troops would have given up the pursuit of their kinsmen only the next morning.”
content_old: 27 And Joab replied, “As God lives, if you hadn’t spoken up, the troops would have given up the pursuit of their kinsmen only the next morning.”

content: 28 Joab then sounded the horn, and all the troops halted; they ceased their pursuit of Israel and stopped the fighting.
content_old: 28 Joab then sounded the horn, and all the troops halted; they ceased their pursuit of Israel and stopped the fighting.

content: 29 Abner and his men marched through the Arabah all that night and, after crossing the Jordan, they marched through all of Bithron until they came to Mahanaim.
content_old: 29 Abner and his men marched through the Arabah all that night and, after crossing the Jordan, they marched through all of Bithron until they came to Mahanaim.

content: 30 After Joab gave up the pursuit of Abner, he assembled all the troops and found nineteen of David’s soldiers missing, besides Asahel.
content_old: 30 After Joab gave up the pursuit of Abner, he assembled all the troops and found nineteen of David’s soldiers missing, besides Asahel.

content: 31 David’s soldiers, on the other hand, defeated the Benjaminites and the men under Abner and killed three hundred and sixty men.
content_old: 31 David’s soldiers, on the other hand, defeated the Benjaminites and the men under Abner and killed three hundred and sixty men.

content: 1 The war between the House of Saul and the House of David was long-drawn-out; but David kept growing stronger, while the House of Saul grew weaker.
content_old: 1 The war between the House of Saul and the House of David was long-drawn-out; but David kept growing stronger, while the House of Saul grew weaker.

content: 2 Sons were born to David in Hebron: His first-born was Amnon, by Ahinoam of Jezreel;
content_old: 2 Sons were born to David in Hebron: His first-born was Amnon, by Ahinoam of Jezreel;

content: 3 his second was Chileab, by Abigail wife of Nabal the Carmelite; the third was Absalom son of Maacah, daughter of King Talmai of Geshur;
content_old: 3 his second was Chileab, by Abigail wife of Nabal the Carmelite; the third was Absalom son of Maacah, daughter of King Talmai of Geshur;

content: 4 the fourth was Adonijah son of Haggith; the fifth was Shephatiah son of Abital;
content_old: 4 the fourth was Adonijah son of Haggith; the fifth was Shephatiah son of Abital;

content: 5 and the sixth was Ithream, by David’s wife Eglah. These were born to David in Hebron.
content_old: 5 and the sixth was Ithream, by David’s wife Eglah. These were born to David in Hebron.

content: 6 During the war between the House of Saul and the House of David, Abner supported the House of Saul.
content_old: 6 During the war between the House of Saul and the House of David, Abner supported the House of Saul.

content: 7 Now Saul had a concubine named Rizpah, daughter of Aiah; and Ish-bosheth said to Abner, “Why have you lain with my father’s concubine?”
content_old: 7 Now Saul had a concubine named Rizpah, daughter of Aiah; and Ish-bosheth said to Abner, “Why have you lain with my father’s concubine?”

content: 8 Abner was very upset by what Ish-bosheth said, and he replied, “Am I a dog’s head from Judah? Here I have been loyally serving the House of your father Saul and his kinsfolk and friends, and I have not betrayed you into the hands of David; yet this day you reproach me over a woman!
content_old: 8 Abner was very upset by what Ish-bosheth said, and he replied, “Am I a dog’s head from Judah? Here I have been loyally serving the House of your father Saul and his kinsfolk and friends, and I have not betrayed you into the hands of David; yet this day you reproach me over a woman!

content: 9 May God do thus and more to Abner if I do not do for David as the LORD swore to him—
content_old: 9 May God do thus and more to Abner if I do not do for David as the LORD swore to him—

content: 10 to transfer the kingship from the House of Saul, and to establish the throne of David over Israel and Judah from Dan to Beer-sheba.”
content_old: 10 to transfer the kingship from the House of Saul, and to establish the throne of David over Israel and Judah from Dan to Beer-sheba.”

content: 11 Ish-bosheth could say nothing more in reply to Abner, because he was afraid of him.
content_old: 11 Ish-bosheth could say nothing more in reply to Abner, because he was afraid of him.

content: 12 Abner immediately sent messengers to David, saying, “To whom shall the land belong?” and to say, “Make a pact with me, and I will help you and bring all Israel over to your side.”
content_old: 12 Abner immediately sent messengers to David, saying, “To whom shall the land belong?” and to say, “Make a pact with me, and I will help you and bring all Israel over to your side.”

content: 13 He replied, “Good; I will make a pact with you. But I make one demand upon you: Do not appear before me unless you bring Michal daughter of Saul when you come before me.”
content_old: 13 He replied, “Good; I will make a pact with you. But I make one demand upon you: Do not appear before me unless you bring Michal daughter of Saul when you come before me.”

content: 14 David also sent messengers to Ish-bosheth son of Saul, to say, “Give me my wife Michal, for whom I paid the bride-price of one hundred Philistine foreskins.”
content_old: 14 David also sent messengers to Ish-bosheth son of Saul, to say, “Give me my wife Michal, for whom I paid the bride-price of one hundred Philistine foreskins.”

content: 15 So Ish-bosheth sent and had her taken away from herhusband, Paltiel son of Laish.
content_old: 15 So Ish-bosheth sent and had her taken away from herhusband, Paltiel son of Laish.

content: 16 Her husband walked with her as far as Bahurim, weeping as he followed her; then Abner ordered him to turn back, and he went back.
content_old: 16 Her husband walked with her as far as Bahurim, weeping as he followed her; then Abner ordered him to turn back, and he went back.

content: 17 Abner had conferred with the elders of Israel, saying, “You have wanted David to be king over you all along.
content_old: 17 Abner had conferred with the elders of Israel, saying, “You have wanted David to be king over you all along.

content: 18 Now act! For the LORD has said concerning David: I will deliver My people Israel from the hands of the Philistines and all its other enemies through My servant David.”
content_old: 18 Now act! For the LORD has said concerning David: I will deliver My people Israel from the hands of the Philistines and all its other enemies through My servant David.”

content: 19 Abner also talked with the Benjaminites; then Abner went and informed David in Hebron of all the wishes of Israel and of the whole House of Benjamin.
content_old: 19 Abner also talked with the Benjaminites; then Abner went and informed David in Hebron of all the wishes of Israel and of the whole House of Benjamin.

content: 20 When Abner came to David in Hebron, accompanied by twenty men, David made a feast for Abner and the men with him.
content_old: 20 When Abner came to David in Hebron, accompanied by twenty men, David made a feast for Abner and the men with him.

content: 21 Abner said to David, “Now I will go and rally all Israel to Your Majesty. They will make a pact with you, and you can reign over all that your heart desires.” And David dismissed Abner, who went away unharmed.
content_old: 21 Abner said to David, “Now I will go and rally all Israel to Your Majesty. They will make a pact with you, and you can reign over all that your heart desires.” And David dismissed Abner, who went away unharmed.

content: 22 Just then David’s soldiers and Joab returned from a raid, bringing much plunder with them; Abner was no longer with David in Hebron, for he had been dismissed and had gone away unharmed.
content_old: 22 Just then David’s soldiers and Joab returned from a raid, bringing much plunder with them; Abner was no longer with David in Hebron, for he had been dismissed and had gone away unharmed.

content: 23 When Joab and the whole force with him arrived, Joab was told that Abner son of Ner had come to the king, had been dismissed by him, and had gone away unharmed.
content_old: 23 When Joab and the whole force with him arrived, Joab was told that Abner son of Ner had come to the king, had been dismissed by him, and had gone away unharmed.

content: 24 Joab went to the king and said, “What have you done? Here Abner came to you; why did you let him go? Now he has gotten away!
content_old: 24 Joab went to the king and said, “What have you done? Here Abner came to you; why did you let him go? Now he has gotten away!

content: 25 Don’t you know that Abner son of Ner came only to deceive you, to learn your comings and goings and to find out all that you are planning?”
content_old: 25 Don’t you know that Abner son of Ner came only to deceive you, to learn your comings and goings and to find out all that you are planning?”

content: 26 Joab left David and sent messengers after Abner, and they brought him back from the cistern of Sirah; but David knew nothing about it.
content_old: 26 Joab left David and sent messengers after Abner, and they brought him back from the cistern of Sirah; but David knew nothing about it.

content: 27 When Abner returned to Hebron, Joab took him aside within the gate to talk to him privately; there he struck him in the belly. Thus Abner died for shedding the blood of Asahel, Joab’s brother.
content_old: 27 When Abner returned to Hebron, Joab took him aside within the gate to talk to him privately; there he struck him in the belly. Thus Abner died for shedding the blood of Asahel, Joab’s brother.

content: 28 Afterward, when David heard of it, he said, “Both I and my kingdom are forever innocent before the LORD of shedding the blood of Abner son of Ner.
content_old: 28 Afterward, when David heard of it, he said, “Both I and my kingdom are forever innocent before the LORD of shedding the blood of Abner son of Ner.

content: 29 May the guilt fall upon the head of Joab and all his father’s house. May the house of Joab never be without someone suffering from a discharge or an eruption, or a male who handles the spindle, or one slain by the sword, or one lacking bread.”—
content_old: 29 May the guilt fall upon the head of Joab and all his father’s house. May the house of Joab never be without someone suffering from a discharge or an eruption, or a male who handles the spindle, or one slain by the sword, or one lacking bread.”—

content: 30 Now Joab and his brother Abishai had killed Abner because he had killed their brother Asahel during the battle at Gibeon.—
content_old: 30 Now Joab and his brother Abishai had killed Abner because he had killed their brother Asahel during the battle at Gibeon.—

content: 31 David then ordered Joab and all the troops with him to rend their clothes, gird on sackcloth, and make lament before Abner; and King David himself walked behind the bier.
content_old: 31 David then ordered Joab and all the troops with him to rend their clothes, gird on sackcloth, and make lament before Abner; and King David himself walked behind the bier.

content: 32 And so they buried Abner at Hebron; the king wept aloud by Abner’s grave, and all the troops wept.
content_old: 32 And so they buried Abner at Hebron; the king wept aloud by Abner’s grave, and all the troops wept.

content: 33 And the king intoned this dirge over Abner, “Should Abner have died the death of a churl?
content_old: 33 And the king intoned this dirge over Abner, “Should Abner have died the death of a churl?

content: 34 Your hands were not bound, Your feet were not put in fetters; But you fell as one falls Before treacherous men!” And all the troops continued to weep over him.
content_old: 34 Your hands were not bound, Your feet were not put in fetters; But you fell as one falls Before treacherous men!” And all the troops continued to weep over him.

content: 35 All the troops came to urge David to eat something while it was still day; but David swore, “May God do thus to me and more if I eat bread or anything else before sundown.”
content_old: 35 All the troops came to urge David to eat something while it was still day; but David swore, “May God do thus to me and more if I eat bread or anything else before sundown.”

content: 36 All the troops took note of it and approved, just as all the troops approved everything else the king did.
content_old: 36 All the troops took note of it and approved, just as all the troops approved everything else the king did.

content: 37 That day all the troops and all Israel knew that it was not by the king’s will that Abner son of Ner was killed.
content_old: 37 That day all the troops and all Israel knew that it was not by the king’s will that Abner son of Ner was killed.

content: 38 And the king said to his soldiers, “You well know that a prince, a great man in Israel, has fallen this day.
content_old: 38 And the king said to his soldiers, “You well know that a prince, a great man in Israel, has fallen this day.

content: 1 When Ish-bosheth son of Saul heard that Abner had died in Hebron, he lost heart and all Israel was alarmed.
content_old: 1 When Ish-bosheth son of Saul heard that Abner had died in Hebron, he lost heart and all Israel was alarmed.

content: 2 The son of Saul had two company commanders, one named Baanah and the other Rechab, sons of Rimmon the Beerothite—Benjaminites, since Beeroth too was considered part of Benjamin.
content_old: 2 The son of Saul had two company commanders, one named Baanah and the other Rechab, sons of Rimmon the Beerothite—Benjaminites, since Beeroth too was considered part of Benjamin.

content: 3 The Beerothites had fled to Gittaim, where they have sojourned to this day.
content_old: 3 The Beerothites had fled to Gittaim, where they have sojourned to this day.

content: 4 Jonathan son of Saul had a son whose feet were crippled. He was five years old when the news about Saul and Jonathan came from Jezreel, and his nurse picked him up and fled; but as she was fleeing in haste, he fell and was lamed. His name was Mephibosheth.
content_old: 4 Jonathan son of Saul had a son whose feet were crippled. He was five years old when the news about Saul and Jonathan came from Jezreel, and his nurse picked him up and fled; but as she was fleeing in haste, he fell and was lamed. His name was Mephibosheth.

content: 5 Rechab and Baanah, sons of Rimmon the Beerothite, started out, and they reached the home of Ish-bosheth at the heat of the day, when he was taking his midday rest.
content_old: 5 Rechab and Baanah, sons of Rimmon the Beerothite, started out, and they reached the home of Ish-bosheth at the heat of the day, when he was taking his midday rest.

content: 6 So they went inside the house, as though fetching wheat, and struck him in the belly. Rechab and his brother Baanah slipped by,
content_old: 6 So they went inside the house, as though fetching wheat, and struck him in the belly. Rechab and his brother Baanah slipped by,
